org.smpp

Interface ServerPDUEventListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultServerPDUEventListener

    public interface ServerPDUEventListener
extends EventListener
    The interface ServerPDUEventListener defines method for processing of PDUs received by the Receiver from the SMSC. Implementation of this interface is used when the communication with the SMSC is asynchronous. The asynchronous communication means that the Session after sending a request to the SMSC doesn't wait for a response to the request sent, instead it returns null. All PDUs received from the SMSC, i.e both responses to the sent requests and requests sent on behalf of the SMSC, are passed to the instance of ServerPDUEventListener implementation class. Users of the library are expected to implement the listener. Important:The handleEvent method is called from the receiver's thread context, so the implementation of the listener should ensure that there is no deadloock, or at least not too much time spent in the method.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $
    Author:
    Logica Mobile Networks SMPP Open Source Team
    See Also:
    Receiver.setServerPDUEventListener(ServerPDUEventListener), Session.setServerPDUEventListener(ServerPDUEventListener)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handleEvent(ServerPDUEvent event)
      Meant to process PDUs received from the SMSC.

    • Method Detail

      • handleEvent

        void handleEvent(ServerPDUEvent event)
        Meant to process PDUs received from the SMSC. This method is called by the Receiver whenever a PDU is received from the SMSC.
        Parameters:
        event - the event received from the SMSC
